prompt.content:
You're CorrectGPT.
You're the best proofreading tool in the world.
You fix grammar and spelling mistakes in English texts.

tests.name: English_German_0
tests.input:
Why are mothers so unfair??
Generally, I can't complain about my mother.
She's the the best anyone could have if it comes to "normal" things.
Plus, she didn't say anything when I quit school.
But now it's different.
Some time ago I told her that I want to become a vegan and she acted as if I had totally lost my mind or something.
We had a argument that took about 3 days, after that I decided to give up and wait to become a vegan when I'll leave the house (in 2011 I think...) but today I found out by accident that my brother has started smoking again and I'm really pissed off right now, not only because I'm against smokers in general but also because my mother thinks these two things can't be compared.
Her strongest point was that I ruin my health by not eating eggs and diary products but when my brother empoisons himself it's something nobody could do anything about.
I keep telling her, that it is just the same thing but she won't believe me.
She is just too stubburn, but so am I...
tests.output:

We had an argument that took about 3 days; after that, I decided to give up and wait to become a vegan when I leave the house. However, today I found out by accident that my brother has started smoking again, and I'm really pissed off right now, not only because I'm against smokers in general, but also because my mother thinks these two things can't be compared.
Her strongest point was that I ruin my health by not eating eggs and dairy products while my brother slowly poisons himself; it's something nobody could do anything about.
I keep on telling her that it is just the same thing, but she won't believe me.
She is just too stubborn, but so am I...

Is there a difference between the words education and upbringing?
In French, these two words are translated the same way.

To my mind, upbringing is used to talk about how parents raise their kids whereas education refers to how you are taught in school

Or can we use both words in both cases?

tests.name: English_Spanish_9
tests.input:
Why do I love my city?
Hi,
My name is Emilio and I'm trying (as many others) to polish my english since it's far from perfect, there's still a lot of words that I don't understand, but this time I want to talk about my city, Tijuana.
I know that most of you may have heard about it, unfortunately the news out there about Tijuana are not the best, it's true that there's violence in here, but it's just like any other major city, we're not excempt (not sure if I'm using this work the right way) from crime, but that doesn't make Tijuana the most dangerous place on earth, as many news reporters have tried to make us believe.
On the other hand, Tijuana is a city of innovation, of art, where many different cultures blend together and form a unique and different culture, rich and diverse.
I love my city and I invite you all to come down here and see for yourselves that you won't get kidnapped, robbed or killed the minute you step in, instead you'll find a very magical city.
tests.output:
Why do I love my city?
Hi,
My name is Emilio, and I'm trying to polish my English since it's far from perfect. There are still a lot of words that I don't understand, but this time I want to talk about my city, Tijuana.
I know that most of you may have heard about it. Unfortunately, the news about Tijuana is not the best. It's true that there's violence here, but it's just like any other major city; we're not an exception. However, that doesn't make Tijuana the most dangerous place on earth, as many news reporters have tried to make us believe.
On the other hand, Tijuana is a city of innovation and art, where many different cultures blend together and form a rich, unique, and diverse culture.
I love my city, and I invite you all to come down here and see for yourselves that you won't get kidnapped, robbed, or killed the minute you arrive. Instead, you'll find a very magical city.
tests.llm_output:
Why do I love my city?
Hi,
My name is Emilio and I'm trying (like many others) to polish my English since it's far from perfect. There are still a lot of words that I don't understand, but this time I want to talk about my city, Tijuana.
I know that most of you may have heard about it. Unfortunately, the news out there about Tijuana is not the best. It's true that there's violence here, but it's just like any other major city. We're not exempt (not sure if I'm using this word the right way) from crime, but that doesn't make Tijuana the most dangerous place on earth, as many news reporters have tried to make us believe.
On the other hand, Tijuana is a city of innovation and art, where many different cultures blend together and form a unique and diverse culture.
I love my city and I invite you all to come down here and see for yourselves that you won't get kidnapped, robbed, or killed the minute you step in. Instead, you'll find a very magical city.

tests.name: English_Other_2
tests.input:
Set foot in Canada
It has been for six years since I had gone abroad in the first time.
Everything looks fresh and excited to me.
When I landed in this uncharted land, my heart was pumping so fast that is about to jump out of my mouth.
We arrived at Brock University at 23:30 by taking the shuttle bus.
The temperature is no longer refresh but a little bit chilling at the mid-night.
At first, I worried my host family should had already gone since it was too late for them; however, when the warm, pale yellow light pierced the silence in the dark, I felt relieved.
I saw my host mom, Rosemary, she wears a blond median-long hair and has a lovely sweet smile.
As she gave me a gracious hug, I just knew that I will fit right in in the next couple weeks.
tests.output:
Set foot in Canada
It has been six years since I went abroad for the first time.
Everything looks fresh and exciting to me.
When I landed in this uncharted land, my heart was pounding so fast that it was about to jump out of my mouth. ^_^
We arrived at Brock University at 23:30 by taking the shuttle bus.
The temperature was no longer refreshing but a little bit chilly at midnight.
At first, I worried my host family would have already left since it was very late for them; however, when the warm, pale yellow light pierced the silence of the dark, I felt relieved.
I saw my host mom, Rosemary, she has blonde medium-long hair and a lovely sweet smile.
As she gave me a gracious hug, I just knew that I would fit in in the next couple of weeks.
tests.llm_output:
Set foot in Canada
It has been six years since I first went abroad.
Everything looks fresh and exciting to me.
When I landed in this uncharted land, my heart was pumping so fast that it was about to jump out of my mouth.
We arrived at Brock University at 23:30 by taking the shuttle bus.
The temperature was no longer refreshing but a little bit chilly at midnight.
At first, I worried my host family might have already left since it was too late for them; however, when the warm, pale yellow light pierced the silence in the dark, I felt relieved.
I saw my host mom, Rosemary, who has blond medium-long hair and a lovely sweet smile.
As she gave me a gracious hug, I just knew that I would fit right in over the next couple of weeks.

tests.name: English_Spanish_2
tests.input:
A house full of animals
Ever since I have memory there's been at least one pet in my house.
We had had dogs, cats, ducks, parrots, hens and chickens, hamsters, fish, an iguane, a turtle and a couple of rabbits (who had like 10 rabbits).
My best friend even drew a comic about me and my animals in school: it was very funny.
The pet I remember and love the most is my dog Randy.
He was 2 or 3 years older than me, he was a dog loved by all the family.
He loved going out and spending time in the streets.
When he wanted to go home he used to "knock" the door with his legs, he was a very intelligent dog :)
When Randy died it was sad.
He was 16 or 17 years old, he was already blind and he couldn't listen very well.
My mom took him to the vet and he never returned...
A couple of days later, because of my questions and my sister's she told us what happened.

Skip Class Lesson
Yesterday, after our physical tests, my classmates and I were really tired and wanted to go home.
After the test, we had to go to another class. But we were really tired and didn't care about the next class, so we all went home.
Haha, we got in a really big trouble. I went back home and went to sleep.
While I was sleeping, my teacher called me to ask why my classmates and I skipped her class.
I told her about the situation. Since my teacher really cares about her students, she didn't get mad at us for skipping her class.
Whew! I knew it, our teacher really does care about us.

Skip class lesson

But we were really tired and didn't care about
the next class lesson, so we actually went home.

Wow, I really knew it; my teacher truly cared about us.

A body of a man who 111 years old was found in Tokyo.

His body was mummified and his family was living with the body for long years.
The same cases have occurred in rapid sequence since the case in Tokyo.
Many old people who are more than 100 years old is missing.

His body was mummified, and his family kept the body for many years.
Similar cases have been reported one after another in Tokyo since.
A number of people over 100 years of age are missing.
We don't know whether they are still alive or not.
The government has undertaken to investigate the case, and more cases like this may be uncovered.
On hearing this news, I now doubt whether Japan really has the highest life expectancy in the world.
